Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus commence the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, my sons, having completed this book, the last on the science of medicine, through the completion of its contents, and due to the explanations contained therein, and through the declarations it makes, I believe you have now grasped fully this treatise, which is a part of the most high art of surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For surgery, considered the most high art in our region and at our time, is entirely shrouded in secrecy, as its science is greatly neglected; only a few small descriptions of it remain in the books of the Ancients, which have led to much confusion and error, as the understanding of its principles is closed off, and its power extended.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And I have found it necessary to revive the order of this treatise through a second method of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and in order that the forms of cautery instruments and other surgical tools may be included for the sake of explanation and preparation, which is essential.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the cause why our artful healers no longer have their hands full in this our time is that the art of medicine is complex, and requires expertise in the science of anatomy, which reveals how everything within [the body] functions and relates to one another; and knowledge of bones, nerves, and ligaments, and the names and movements of these; and the veins, both pulsing and static, and their locations.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason Hippocrates says that the name is fitting, but in practice it is small, especially in the art of healing.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already said this at the beginning of this book; for those who do not know what we have told you about anatomy, they are not exempt from making mistakes that will lead to the death of men, as you have seen many of them who are formed in this science but lack real knowledge and rely on theory and experiment.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	You see a foolish doctor who has incurred an infected abscess in the thigh of a woman and incised some arteries in her thigh so that much blood flows within, causing the woman to die between his legs.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And you see another doctor who prescribed a stone from a man who had passed it in his state; the stone was large, and he came to him and extracted that stone with part of his bladder, so that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you have already summoned help to extract it, and you see that because of the size of the stone and the disposition of the patient's condition, he will die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And you see another doctor who was taking payment from a duke of our land for surgery, and he operated on a black crusted ulcer that was deeply infected in the patient's thigh; because of the doctor's ignorance, he extracted the fracture above the wound, using poultices and planks with strong tension, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then release it according to their desires, and apply rest, and take away the swelling for some days, and command that we loosen the ligament; and thus, until the matter and the pain in the foot are resolved, and brought to healing.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And you have been called to loosen the ligament, and by doing so, achieve tranquility and thus alleviate their pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, if the corruption is already confirmed in the member, then it cannot be restrained, and the corruption continues to spread throughout the member until the danger of the illness increases.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And there is another doctor who perforates a cancerous abscess, and it becomes ulcerated after some days, until the evil of it increases under the control of its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which causes is because the pain in the cancer is pure melancholic humour, and it does not cover that it will reach him with a sharp weapon, but rather affects the member in which it suffers most.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation be carefully devised in two stages: first, the operation associated with health, and second, the work which is perilous to the greatest dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already encountered this in every place of this book where we speak of operations involving error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to pay attention and set aside that which leads people astray from speaking and shames you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore, take up your weapons with diligence and the protection of God, and your patients with ease and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best means for the grace of God leading to salvation and glorious success, and set aside the terrible illnesses of difficult healing, and cease using those things that make you fear, so that your confidence in your faith and in His name does not desert you: for greater glory remains for you, and more honor both in this world and in the next, to your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	They already dissected in some of their own organs:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat bad diseases improperly, so that bad doctors do not become famous.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you have already divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first, the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter organized within the feet, in the forms of instruments and in the tools of cautery, and of what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter deals with incisions and punctures, and also with venoms, and with extracts of arrows and similar objects, all chapters and ordered according to the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and repositioning, and on the cure of twists and similar conditions; a well-ordered chapter on internal foot care and the shapes of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On cautery with fire and sharp medicine, and the remembrance of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	At that point begins the treatment of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Understand what I have said about the quality of the youth of that cautery and the documents of it, and in what conditions cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, it is said that the discourse on the quality of cautery's youth and the documents of it is long and prolix, subtle for knowledge, and secrets hidden; and much has been spoken about it by many wise men, and there are disagreements among them, so I will content myself with a small part of their discourses, fearing prolongation.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore it is said that cauterization will apply to the entire universal connection, which is of material or its material, except for two connections, which are connections whose material is itself.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the connection that is dry and lacks material, opinions differ; some say that cauterization is beneficial to it, while others claim the opposite, stating that cauterization is not appropriate for ailments characterized by quality and dryness, as the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it would be counterproductive to treat a condition that is dry and lacking in moisture with heat.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who claim the opposite state that cauterization is beneficial for all dry and dehydrated ailments in the bodies of men, as when you compare the body of a man and its humidity to the connection with fire, you find the body of a man to be rough.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And he says through the argument of those who claim this, that he himself has already discovered it through experience several times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not appropriate for someone who has already been exhausted and practiced in the chapter of cautery for further training, and who knows the diversity of the composition of people and the disposition of ailments in their bodies, and the causes of those, and the accidents of them, and the space of time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other situations, there is no need for fear, especially in dry and humid ailments, as all doctors are agreed on these, and they are not discordant in the application of cautery to them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my sons, that the secret of healing by cautery with fire and the goodness of it, lie in cautery over medicine, for fire is simple, whose action only reaches the member to be cauterized, and does not affect other members with its heat except with a slight discomfort.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of medicine combined with fire reaches that member from which it departs, and strongly drives away the sick member of difficult healing, and strongly assists.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Light, due to its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not cause this but exceeds. It is already known to us from experience and from a long service of studying the art based on the truth of causes; for this reason, I excuse you from the length of my speech. And if it were not that it is hidden from me in this brief moment, I would reveal to you the secret fire, and the quality of the operation in the body and its expulsion through which you expel illnesses, demonstrated by philosophical discourse, which would be sharpened in your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that the times of disagreement from which these diseases arise are in the springtime, when it is most convenient to make cauterization and apply pressure.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And you say that cauterization is convenient at all times, so that the damage caused by accidental time is overshadowed by the healing of what is thrown off by cauterization, and even more so if the cauterization is for pains or necessary pains, severe and extensive, which do not suffer from delay, because it is feared those that come with evil, that it is better to have a little damage entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And so do not sit on your feet, my children, for it is only the common people and foolish doctors who value such things, for that disease which is healed by cautery does not fully recover, and leaves a scar.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason is not thus as they believe, for cautery is but a place of medicine which alters the composition and dries up moisture, which is the cause why pain comes.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Yet doctors may use cautery excessively over medicine because of their desire for its power, virtue, and the greatness of their lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that their illness may return at some time in the future, according to the nature of the illness and its location, and the power of it, and what is prepared within the body from the addition of excesses in it, and what has come upon it from food and similar causes; for the illness in which cautery is administered is a subtle illness in members with few excesses and moisture, just as a tooth cautery for pain and similar things, so it may not return that pain in it, but this is done in small measures.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is common in popular speech that a cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and although it may seem the rightest thing to do, they believe that it is not a cure that benefits from medicine or any other cause through cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the reason is to the contrary; and the understanding that a cautery is the last remedy of medicine is not so much as when one applies the methods of healing in certain ailments, and those medicines do not work, and at the end of the cause, one administers a cautery to benefit from it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here it follows that a cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the understanding of the common people and too many of the foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said that a gold cautery is better than an iron cautery, and they did not say this except for the equality of the gold and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they say that the place of cautery does not burn unless it is absolutely true, for you have already seen and experienced that it only burns in some bodies, and cauterization on that spot is good and better than what they said; nevertheless, when you make a cauterization with fire from gold, it is not clearly declared, because the amount of gold you want determines the severity of the burn, and since you prepare to receive friction; and if you place it over the flame, the gold melts in the fire, and sometimes some sheets fall into the fire so that the craftsman can catch them due to the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, cauterization with iron must be made more gently and precisely to ensure the correctness of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	You have already organized this chapter on cauterization according to other chapters, and you have organized those within the feet first, so that now I am asking him what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	With a cold cautery for head pain due to coldness and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	**First Chapter**
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery confers upon the servant the benefit of humidity and coldness as remedies for various accidents, which are two causes of severe and numerous rheumatic fluxes, called rigor, from the head to the parts of the senses and ears, flowing excessively, and also from sleep, toothache, and throat pain, and generally from any ill health that arises from cold, similarly in cases of paralysis, apoplexy, and similar ailments.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cautery is as follows: first, command that the illness be evacuated using a laxative on the head, for three or four nights, depending on the severity of the illness, the age of the patient, and their usual condition.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then he commands them to shave their head, and make that cut between your thighs on a prepared bench, and place their hands on the patient's feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then he places the palm of his hand, pressing it against the root of the nose between the patient's feet.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, if the swelling in the affected area has subsided, mark that place with a sign, and then apply the olive-shaped pointed cautery to it.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then he places that over the healthy area marked with a sign, descending in such a way that the patient's hand is gradually constrained, and you remove that.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then he gently lifts his hand and examines the area, and if you notice any bones exposed, along with the quantity of grit or stones, raise your hand again, and if it doesn't return to that position firmly, use another instrument from those nearby, or one cooled down, as long as it's visible to the bone, which I have already mentioned.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it over the area and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then apply pressure on the burned area at the border, and leave it on the inner part until the skin's barrier is destroyed by the heat.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then clean the area with a four-ingredient ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it is said that when the Roman plague opens, the better the arm gets, so it is better and more youthful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they say that some parts of the bone should be cauterized and the cautery should be held until a part of the bone's spirit is dried up.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then remove the part that is attached to the bone, and clean it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And they say that the cautery should be applied to the back, first strengthening the bone with a powerful tool, and this is the form of the small knife used for lancing:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that area, vapours from the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then it should be treated until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I do not have sight of these two types of cautery in all cases, but only in some men according to the way of fear; and let this be enough for me: health is best when it is present, as we have witnessed in the other members, and especially when the head of the patient is naturally hot.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the specific type of cautery that comes first is the safest and best for me; and from that and in that work, health comes.
Capitol segon.	Second Chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	On the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and persistent pain occurs throughout the head and these symptoms prolong in the patient's suffering, it is customary to use various remedies such as blades, splints, poultices, emplasters, salves, leeches, and dogs, and even more, but especially if a cautery has already been performed that does not address the root cause of the malady. Consider this: if the head of the patient's illness is of a strong and inherent nature, and there is no severe or obvious external injury, then such cauterization with another cautery should be left to one side for the time being.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that part of the head where the bone is cracked using an internal cautery.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the bone and expose the amount we have found, then cauterize that with an internal cautery at the rear part of the head in the area known as the "vat" – it is the location where the wind is stopped.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And apply your hand there, do not expose the bone, for the malady finds great pain through it, unlike all other burns on the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And you should apply this cautery in its proper place, because you know that the cautery which treats the horns of the head and the occipital region is a more subtle cautery than the one applied to the middle part of the head; this is its form.
Capitol ters.	Capital chapters.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the treatment of old migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a severe headache occurs at the temple or inside the head, and pain is spread throughout the body, it is treated with medications that clarify the head, and other remedies as mentioned in the treatment of illnesses; if these do not prove effective, then cauterization is performed in two ways: either with sharp, burning medicines or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	Make use of cauterizing medicines or burning ointments, take a hot compress and cut open the affected area on both sides of its ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then, with a lance, cut into the site of pain in the temple, deeply enough to reach the bone, but not to expose it.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then tighten it with a bandage after applying a cold compress, leaving it for three hours; afterwards, remove the compress and place the affected area in hot water for two or three days, then apply a new bandage to the cooled site.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a salve to that area until it heals.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you choose to do this, follow the instructions I have written in the two treatises on burning medicines that I have mentioned above.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Apply the cautery according to this manner: take a hot iron whose shape is as follows:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called a claw clamp because its head has the shape of a claw with some curvature, and in the middle part there is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then apply pressure over the painful area, hold your hand—to prevent the skin from blistering—and slowly turn the hot iron at a gentle pace.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of blood that clings to the specific part due to the heat of the iron is such that it covers most of it, raise your hand so that the artery beneath does not adhere, preventing any flow of pus.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then clean the area with salt water and place a dressing over it, leaving it for three days. Apply a lot of ointment around the wound until it heals.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, burn the edge of the knife with a cautery, and be careful not to incise an artery in this newly formed injury.
Capitol quart.	Capital quarter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterization of ancient injuries.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat an ancient injury as we have discussed in the previous section on the treatment of various ailments, and if the treatment is not effective, and the pain persists due to a lack of light (or proper care), then ignite the cautery knife while it is still sharp, focusing on the area of greatest pain along its length. Rest your hand for a moment and press down as you make the incision to reach the underlying artery.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be vigilant regarding the continuation of the mandible, which is severely damaged due to lack of chewing, and ensure that the wound is not infected, and the nerves which are affected, do not have spasms.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it concerns the prevention and care of the flow of blood from an artery that is compromised, as in the case of its occlusion, there is fear, especially for him who does not understand what causes it and lacks study and patience; thus, delay the operation upon it at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And now come to the remembrance of the rules for dealing with the flow of blood from an artery, as it happens, according to their manner, in their place within this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this ailment does not respond to the cautery and you judge the patient's condition tolerable, apply the cautery in the middle part of the head as we have mentioned, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you find it necessary, administer the cautery that we have mentioned in the chapter on artery constriction using a two-pronged cautery, this is a better and more effective cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the treatment of ear pain.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear due to cold and it is treated with lacrimal and other remedies as mentioned in the previous section, and the pain persists, apply heat with a cautery. This is known as a "puncta," and its shape is as follows:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then apply the cautery close to the heat source, and rotate it around the entire ear, or in the form of a circle over whichever part is painful.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Use the cautery on the edge of the ear pain, little by little, until you have relieved the area without causing any harm.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery with these points is done on the entire ear and some remain, then treat the areas until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter .vi.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of tortuous (or twisted) parts.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	The tortuousness which is cured and the cauterization, in this case, refer to the species that come from phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoiding cauterization of the species that should be treated by drying or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that species of tortuousness with pulling and snapping and groaning, and you do not confirm your cure, then know that you cauterize the illness in three places: first, you pierce the auricle, second, you make a small cut on their temple, and third, you treat the union of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And apply your cautery to the opposite side of the affected part, for softening occurs only in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cauterization is as follows: cauterize that part with a cautery instrument directly on the tip of the ear, and another at the temple, whose length corresponds to the length of the finger, and place your hand over the cautery until the quantity of the substance of the skin is consumed.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the form of the cautery, and it is specific to the cutting tool, the shape of which is placed on the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it may be even more subtle, as you will see with your own eyes; and take care to avoid excessive roughness on its surface.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the area that is exposed during the procedure until it heals.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter .VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the cauterization of ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and its treatment does not include what we have mentioned and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize it with four cauteries: first on all the corners of their head; second, on the middle part of the head, as we have said; and third, on the nape.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of the cautery is done according to what has been mentioned above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it is cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; and this is more deferred; and then its treatment is as you process.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter .VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	About the cauterization of a hernia made with flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	You should give the patient at the beginning small doses of grains and pills, the servants will gradually increase them.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then completely shave the patient's head, and place on their wound the plaster described in the treatment of plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And do this at certain intervals, for that is the manner of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the order of the methods I have already mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And thus if they prove beneficial for him, otherwise make three cauterizations on the last part of his head, descending from the higher part of the head to the lower part towards the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And between each cautery, hold the thick part of the finger, and then carefully apply the cautery according to the procedure.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If you can add more assistance and the patient tolerates it, then make the cautery on the middle part; but if you need even more help, cauterize that over the two joints.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Carefully tend to the inside so that it heals; and the cautery should be olive-shaped according to the form given above.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the procedure for relieving parasites and softening throughout the body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Now that you have understood the procedure for the softening of the head in accordance with what we have said; then carefully shave the patient's head, and apply cautery to it at the middle part, and cauterize all the joints of the head, and cauterize over the rear part of it, and make three cauteries over the spinal columns of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the case of softening the body from too much cold and the pain persists, while the disease is strong, cauterize with four cauteries on the spinal columns of the back, then apply cautery until the intense pain subsides, and raise your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then attend to it until it is healed, and this cauterization should be with olive oil.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	Epilepsy is not cauterized, but if it is due to phlegm, then cauterization is indicated.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore, it is important to purify the brain of the patient at the beginning, when you have used fire and other remedies as described in our previous discussion, where the disease is severe and resistant to medical treatments.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not endure medicines, then administer warm and soothing drinks to the servant who purifies them, for several days, as a benefit of the foods.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the head of the patient, and apply a cautery to that area with a cautery in the middle part of the head according to the previous manner, and apply another cautery at the back of their head, and over each corner of the head where it has been cauterized.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient's condition is severe and they are tolerant, then cauterize with cauteries as mentioned, having a paralytic and soothing effect on the body over the spinal columns of the neck and the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And apply the olive cautery as mentioned above.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	If the patient is a child, then apply gentle cauteries according to this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter .XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On cauterization of melancholia.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholia are corrupted corrupt humors and gross phlegm, cauterize them with the cauterizes that we have mentioned in having paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholia is an excess that declines to melancholia, and the body of the patient is humid, then give him something that purifies his mind from it according to what has been preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the head of the patient, then apply a moderate torture to him on the circle, and then rest it in the middle part of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should feel relieved, and be held from all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a liniment; it is more worthy to be done before shearing sheep.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that above the fire for a measured warm temperature, which tells her to suffer more when it is in place.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then take that in the middle part of his head in a circular manner, and wash it until it is cooled.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this for the patient every day for a week, following his diet until he is cured; or if you wish, cauterize those making small points as best as possible, holding your hand over it equally: this is a type of cautery that moistens the brain to equal effect.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then apply that moistened cloth on the border or in the folds of a grey goose.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter .xii.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the treatment of water retention in the legs.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When the onset of water retention in the legs is recognized by the signs I have mentioned in the previous section, it begins and should be treated by giving the patient a drink that purges the head, and care should be taken of all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And he should take baths with specific herbs for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And he should command the patient to wash their head, and cauterize the affected area with a hot iron at the middle of the head; and if water retention begins in two legs, he should cauterize with two irons over both temples, or with one iron on one side of the head if the onset is in one leg.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut with a cautery all the veins and arteries that are left by the cord; and the cauterizes should be on that length in the breadth of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful of blood flows when cauterizing; and if you see blood flowing from it, stop any further treatment, which is within your power.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And come to knowledge that is in extraction of arteries and amputation of those, and caution against blood flows.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes cautery is performed on the neck where two bones are joined with two cauterizes, thereby producing healing.
Capitol .xiii.	**Chapter XIII**
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	**On the cauterization of ancient tears.**
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears of the eyes are frequent and through veins and arteries which appear in the external part of the head, and it is observed that there is an excess of fluid causing muscle weakness, then cauterize that place with a cautery as we have described in the chapter on starting hot water in the eyes, and apply a cautery in the middle part of the head and two cauteries below the temples, and two cauteries below the bones of the neck.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if there is additional indigestion, then cauterize that on all parts of the eye's coat over the edge of the upper eyelid with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	**Chapter XIII**
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	**On the Cauterization of Nasal Discharge:**
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat someone with the condition we have described in the previous section and your treatment does not prove effective, then prepare a mixture for the patient to drink for three nights; also, shave their head, and cauterize with a middle-sized olive cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then apply the cautery, using a pointed cautery on both eyelids, leaving the hairs intact.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And beware of the fire so as not to burn that.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the cautery with the clavel.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the softening of the eyelids with a cautery.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by disease or moisture, apply a cautery to that eyelid with a pointed cautery, like this:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, apply the cautery to both eyebrows with a small pointed cautery along their entire length, and they will become elongated from the tempora.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the quantity of the protrusion.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with the cautery, but according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Regarding the cautery of the eyelid, when the hairs turn inside out and close up the eye, apply the cautery to the lid.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eyelid turn inside out and close up the eye, applying a cautery to it is done in two ways: either as a burning cautery or as a medicinal cautery.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you are using a fire cautery, command the patient to look away from where you will cut their hairs, so that they do not see; and if you must, place your hand over their eyes with a bandage, so that the hairs remain uncut.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Therefore, when they are clean and dried, place the patient's head in a favorable position, and then pay attention to the eyelids of the affected eye, signaling it according to the shape of a dead leaf, and this is the beginning of the sign close to the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then apply a cold compress or a wet cloth over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then heat the cautery, shaping it as required.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize along the marked figure, gradually, in several passes, until the surface of the wound is completely sealed, just as if it were with a leaf of myrtle, clearly visible.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of the successful treatment is that you see the eyelid of the eye contract and the hairs stand up at the site of the puncture.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And so raise your hand and place it there for three days, then remove it gradually until the swelling subsides.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then apply that ointment until it heals.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	If it returns for any reason and the eyelid becomes softened, then make another cautery on that part just as you had done originally.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	If the hair is in the eyelid, then cauterize it until it is raised to its natural position, sealed, and the hair does not reappear.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with medicinal fire is that you command the patient to pull out the hair until it is prolonged and sealed, and then make a paper-like bandage in the shape of a myrtle leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then apply soap known for its healing properties mixed with warm water, forming a paste like the leaf of myrtle, and place it on the affected joint or both; leave the moistened wound covered in white honey and keep the patient's head elevated.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And now I will explain this further regarding the medicine; apply a small amount and do not be afraid if the patient feels the stinging of the medicine, for stinging is like fire in it.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And so, as you continue to observe the patient and see that the medicine's stinging subsides, stop administering it and apply a cold compress to the affected area; then consider how many times the eyelid has been lifted—just as it is washed—due to either burning or cutting, as is appropriate. And if it does not return to the application of the medicine on the spot where the medicine was initially placed, do not be concerned, for your operation will succeed and the wound will contract.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place your hand over it, until the pain of the adhesion is eradicated, and treat that with a definite ointment or another until it heals.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, in your operation, to pay close attention that no part of the medicine falls from the eye, and if the eyelid becomes softened after several days due to any cause from the hairs in the eye, then repeat your medicine on that area which has become softened from the eyelid, and precisely as you did at the beginning, and leave it until it heals.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the method of making a cupping glass.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you know that the eyes of men differ in size and smallness, and therefore your compression should be made according to that.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And let the way of treatment not be hidden from him who studies this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter .xvii.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On cauterization of fistulas that are in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with the method we have described in the sections on illnesses and your treatment does not succeed, then know that you cauterize it as follows: command the patient to hold their head in a certain position, and place a minister's head between their thighs in such a way that it is neither hurt nor agitated by their own head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then apply some hot compress or a cloth dipped in honey over the patient's eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then heat the cautery, which is shaped as follows:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is curved, resembling a cane or a coil of a spring, from one end where the cautery is applied.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you look, it penetrates into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish to come out this way, do so with caution.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, he who is cautious is better at the work itself.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And if the fistula is open, press it so that it heals and dries out.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and remove the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And place the hot cautery over it, and with your hand protect the skin from the cautery at the root of the nose, so that neither your hand or the patient is disturbed, and then apply the cautery to the gray parts of the nose and burn that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And therefore, if at the beginning of the cautery it penetrates into the bone, well done; otherwise, repeat the cautery once or twice, as necessary, and leave it thus for three days, then apply a compress with a dry ointment until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If after passing ten days it is still not healed, then apply the sharp, corrosive medicine again until the bone is exposed and treated as appropriate in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	There is another way to perform a fistula cautery that some first described: enter the location of the fistula and dry it, then apply pressure to the small crack from which it emerges. You make a seal over the area with as much care as possible, preventing any further harm to the patient so that the melted lead does not penetrate into the wound; cover the wound of the patient with an albumen or water, because the lead will adhere to the site of the fistula and heal it through miraculous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula heals with what we have mentioned about cautery and treatment, it is good; otherwise, it will be necessary to apply a drain from the nose and reduce the fistula to the nasal cavity according to its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	**Chapter XVIII**
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	**On the Cauterization of the Hernia Opening**
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Frequent accidents cause openings in the lips, especially in children's lips.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, if you treat those openings as we have mentioned in the divisions and do not take advantage of your treatment, then use a hot iron in the shape of a small knife as follows:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And the depth of the opening should be according to the thinness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Place the bandage carefully over those cracks so that the cautery reaches the depth of the cracks.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then take care of that moist wound until it heals.
Capitol .xix.	**Chapter XIX**
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	**On the Cauterization of Fistulas in the Mouth**
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When, during the extraction of the uvula, or in the palate or around the teeth, an abscess forms and it bursts, and it becomes chronic, and a fistula opens up, and you treat it but do not give proper care, then you should light a cautery according to the size of the fistula, and insert that burning cautery into the opening of the fistula, and with your hand guide the burning instrument to the depth of the fistula, doing this once or twice; and afterward, apply the treatments we have mentioned for healing until it is cured.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so if the wound is clean and healed, it is good; otherwise, it is necessary to expose the location and host the corrupt bone as will be discussed in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	**Capitol XX.**
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the treatment of teeth and the softening of arteries.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When arteries are softened by moisture and teeth are decayed, and these conditions are treated with medications rather than surgery, then the doctor should place the patient's head in a certain position, and shape the cautery so that it can be inserted between the tooth and the gum, where the fiery tip of the ignited cautery will penetrate gently without causing great pain to the patient.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then remove your hand, and repeat the application of the cautery several times as desired.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient rinse their mouth with salt water and do this for an hour, afterward stop it; for the decayed tooth will be held in place, the softened gums will be tightened, and the corrupted moisture will be dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter .xxi.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the treatment of tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to coldness or there is a frost or vermin in it, and the cure does not come from medicine, then cautery should be performed on that part in two ways: either with cow dung cautery or fire cautery.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with cow dung is to take cow dung and boil it in a ferrule, then take hold of it and wrap it around the extremity of the tooth, and then immerse that in boiling cow dung, and place it over the painful tooth until it is numbed.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat this several times until the power of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you see, immerse a cloth or bandage in hot water, place it on the painful tooth, and hold it there until the heat reaches the depth of the tooth's cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the use of fire for cauterization is only indicated for burns or wounds, and it should be applied with care to avoid any harshness or the heat not reaching the wound's opening.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then shape the cautery as required, place it on the tooth, and hold your hand over it until the cautery cools down; do this several times as the pain may return either that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And ensure that, by pressing the cautery, the patient opens their mouth well and holds it for an hour, then gently remove it; this is the shape of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And apply the cautery as you have prepared it according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the shape of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter .XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On cauterization of extrophules.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrophules are filled with phlegm and humors that are resistant to digestion by medications, and you need to force their discharge, then apply the cautery precisely following its shape, having two open ends so that the smoke from the cautery reaches both of them. Once one end has been treated, move the burning instrument to another area as needed until the extrophule is emptied.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the extrophule is small, then apply the cautery according to its size, and wrap it tightly for three days, placing a clean dressing over it until the burned area has healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then apply that medicinal ointment and bandages until it heals.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the catheter or cautery for such use is conveyed.
Capitol .xxiii.	**Chapter XXIII**
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of wounds and the constriction of veins.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity appears on the pleura of the lung, especially when it is chilled by a sudden cold, it is necessary to evacuate that illness at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize that place with a hot iron in the affected area.
