It is not cut too sharply as with wounds, nor does it have an acute edge so that it does not harm the vein; instead, it has great flexibility, for if it were too thin, it would pierce the vein due to its thinness; thus, it has a sufficient thickness as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of the removal of the vein of the thigh.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in hot regions, as well as in the hernia on Arabic land and in the rear and arid lands of India with little greenery or openness.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And moreover, the vein is also generated in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And the process of decomposition is such that it causes pus to come out from within the body, snakes and worms, and parasites that are born between the fester and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And the sign of the onset of gout is that a violent inflammation occurs in the leg; then the area becomes swollen; and shortly after, the vein begins to leave the affected area, which seems to be torn from within, like a plant's root.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And when the onset of gout becomes apparent, you will notice that you must wrap around it a piece of lead whose weight is equal to that of a dragon. Within this dragon, put the affected area and leave the lead suspended from the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And whenever you see any cause for gout to occur outside of the body, wrap it in lead and note this.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the pain persists, you make an incision into it and wrap the wound; do not dig deeply with a knife unless it has come to the surface, for if you dig too deep, it contracts and goes into the flesh, causing abscesses and gangrene in the area, and bad ulcers.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	For it is important that the growth be treated gradually and extracted little by little, until it has completely come out from the body, without leaving any cause for its return within the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, some men have reported that it extends to the length of their palm and fingers, and I myself have witnessed one case where it extended for 10 palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if an incision is made during treatment, you insert the ray into the channel of it and perforate that deep channel in the flesh, so that all that is within the matter may be evacuated, and apply putrefaction to the place for some days using medicines; then take care of it for the healing of abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein is sometimes seen with great swelling, especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or on the foot, and it causes great pain, and it emanates from each painful point.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore treat that as we have said in the division and pay attention to what is mentioned above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Regarding the section about worms generated under the skin, and it is called bovine inflammation.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This illness is called bovine fever in some countries because it causes great pain in the cows and a few worms are found between the intestines and flesh, which enter the whole body, causing swelling and destruction, and their symptoms are most evident when they break the intestines and push them out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And the generation of this disease is due to the putrefaction of certain humors, which causes worms and serpents and roundworms and ascariasis in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared by its malice, for when it enters the body and rises to the head, it reaches the blood, then severely breaks and destroys the blood vessels, and this should be treated with care.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And so when you wish to cure and extract it, you must not do so unless you understand its movement and appearance in the body, and then grasp what is above it and what remains below it with strong compression, and dry it and extract that.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is deeply embedded in the flesh and does not cause pain, then apply a hot cautery at the place where it resides, and the main cause that is feared is its corruption, which also corrupts the place as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	If it has reached the head near the blood vessels, then grasp the upper eyelid with strong compression, and dry it, and extract that. And take care that this malady uses purification of the body by medicines that expel putrid bad humors, and be cautious of foods that cause putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	On the incision above the disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is called "nafir" in our land, and it is a pain that occurs in some members, and then it changes from one member to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And you have already seen that second one that I will recommend to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	You were called to a female patient in a village, and upon discovering her arm, you saw a small inflammation in the vein at the wrist, which had been broken for an hour. As it was being examined, this inflammation seemed to spread, almost like living silver as it moved from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	Then they removed the pain from that place and applied pressure to the muscle, and held it for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then correct the other body until you reach the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then I noticed that I had to revolve myself in every part of the body as I had seen; and it was too amazing from the permutation of it and the speed of its members.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had already seen this in my feet according to that manner, however I have seen many which shock with pain being permuted from member to member.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	I have never seen this in the feet like on a woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not think that this was anything but that it was because the woman was crippled, with dry skin and exposed veins, and in this condition, the sensation of that permuted air appeared.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that this retro-cures not be apparent in those who are delicate and have moist bodies with narrowed veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And if you wish to cure him and the patient feels that pain, then it is not apparent as we have said, tighten over that and let him lie lightly and dry on that until the air circulation is restored, and cauterize the place.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	If you cannot find them in your feet, then cure that by relieving the body and removing the air circulation, and bind those with foul-smelling pills and serpentine pills.
De extraccio de sagetas.	From the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows vary according to species and according to the parts of the body they hit, for their diversity lies in that some have sharp points, others small, concave, or dull, being solid; and some have three angles, or tongues, or are saw-toothed.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And according to the members and parts where it strikes, it acts in two ways: for the principal members, such as the brain, heart, liver, lungs, ribs, bladders, and their like, when it attacks any of these members and signals your impending death, which cause I will relate below, you must then avoid extraction of that arrow from those parts where death is that member in which the worst conditions occur, and when these malaises do not appear, and the arrow is not hidden in the depth of the member, then extract that one and cure the plague.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And among the signs of severe illness is when an arrow strikes in it and penetrates the bone, especially the one above the brain, due to violent heat, and causes scotomies, vertigo, pain in the legs, inflammation and pain in the tongue, spasms, and mixing up of speech, vomiting of bile, and a strong loss of words, and destruction of the voice, and leaves at the site of the illness a white humidity resembling powder, and it has characteristics similar to those of flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And if these symptoms appear to you, then abstain from treatment and extraction of the arrow, unless it is protruding.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	If the arrow enters the heart, so that it is near the left breast, and you feel a sudden, severe pain, not visible from the outside, and strongly perceive the movement of the arrow as similar to the pulse and the flow of black blood, and there is a coldness in the extremities, shortness of breath, and fainting; then know that death is at hand.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the symptoms when the arrow has pierced the lung, showing pus from the plague, and the vessels near the collarbone are affected, and the patient's condition changes, breathing heavily and requesting fresh air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow strikes the membrane in the foot, and the pain is localized to the small ribs, it causes intense pain and heavy breathing, and all the muscles of the body are greatly affected.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if an arrow strikes the stomach, it will immediately alleviate the pain of any undigested food.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if an arrow strikes the abdomen and becomes stuck in it, causing a tear or rupture of the organ, whether it be the gut or hernia, there is little hope for its healing through removal of the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow strikes the bladder and causes it to release urine outside, resulting in any discharge due to its impact, and intense pain grips the patient, then you should know that it is a fatal wound.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	The other members, such as the face, neck, head, shoulders, elbow, hip, thigh, leg, and similar parts of the limbs, can be saved with careful handling when the arrow does not strike a vein or artery and is not a venomous dart.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will tell you about what I have seen regarding the nature of these arrows, so that you may understand their application in treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause of which is that when an arrow strikes the lacrimal bone of a man's eye in the root of his nose and it is extracted from him on another day, leaving the grays of his eyebrow intact, then he recovers, and there is no injury to his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And another arrow was extracted from a Jew, which had struck him in the grays of his eye, leaving the eyelid intact, and the arrow was hidden and could not be removed from there except for a small tip to which it clung, and it was a large arrow among the sharp arrows of the Turks, capable of striking a lion without leaving an auricle.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew was healed, and there was no further damage to his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And extract another arrow from a Christian man who had fallen into his throat, which was an Arabic arrow, and it is the one with feathers; and then I incised between two guides, and it was already submerged in the man's throat; and then I carefully removed it, and thus healed the Christian.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I extracted another arrow from a man who had fallen into his belly, and I realized that he was dying from it; so, after we had passed thirty days and nothing had changed regarding the state of his organs, I incised onto the arrow and manipulated it, and thus he was healed, without any further complications.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw a man in whom an arrow had stuck in his back, and the pain was concentrated on him, and after applying heat for some time, I pulled out the arrow at the base of the wound.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman who had an arrow stuck in her belly, and the pain was deep inside her, and it did not change with any of her organs' functions, and the woman suffered no severe disruption of her natural operations.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And he sees another man to whom an arrow has struck his face, the wound is deep and the arrow breaks, causing little pain but many similar symptoms.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And he extracted the arrow from the face of the prince of the king who had been struck in the middle part of his nose and had already bent to the right a little; the whole arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And you were called for the treatment of him, soon after the arrow's wounding, within three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	Then he carefully examined the wound of the arrow, and found it deep; then he sought that subtle attempt, and did not feel it; but he felt a sharp pain leaving the right ear, and then he hoped that that pain was from the end of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	He then applied a plaster to the place with a drawing and digestive effect, hoping that by doing so he would draw out the arrow from that place.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And do not open in the place of the injury where the arrow has struck; continue to apply poultice over it for several days, and no further injury occurs; and as the plague solidifies between them, break up the obstruction from the opening by intervals of several days until on one day you feel the arrow within its neck and reconnect it to me.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then stop over the injury with a sharp corrosive medicine for several days until a wound opens, and try to soothe it, and cut off the tip of the arrow, which adheres to the wood.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	Then adjust the opening of the wound with that acute medicine until I see visibly the tip of the arrow, and spend time on it for intervals of time up to four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	Then I made the wound more enlarged, and I managed to insert forks into it, and maintained them, and did not give up trying, when suddenly one day through ingenious ways I managed to take hold of it with forceps, as will be the form of those in the end of the chapter, until I removed that; and then I restored that wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some physicians judged that the cartilage of the nose could not be restored, and they restored it so that the disease was consolidated and the illness was healed entirely, without any recurrence.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recommend to you the quality of extraction of some arrows in order to give this rule and meaning regarding what has not been said, for the parts of this art and the definitions of that are not understood from the narration, nor can one comprehend those in the book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the wise artisans speak little about what is present, and much more about what is absent; and they seek new operations and new instruments for the descent of foreign causes from the art when accidents occur.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	Therefore, you say that arrows are not extruded from the members in which they are embedded, but according to two manners: either by attraction of the place in which they intertwine; or conversely, from the other side.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is discharged from the place where it enters, or is an arrow proceeding through fleshy parts, and is thrown out and removed.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not adhere to the timing of when to eat, soon you will leave it for a few days until the flesh around it rots and the attraction of it and its exit are relieved.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And similarly, if it becomes lodged in the bones and you do not adhere to eating times, leave it for a few days until it relieves itself of attraction and motion on certain days, and then it will be discharged.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if you do not adhere to your diet for a few days, soon you will puncture the path of the arrow in that bone at a subtle journey until the location is enlarged by the arrow, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if an arrow is embedded in the skull bone and has pierced one of the brain's cavities, and symptoms of those injuries appear, do not extract the arrow immediately but leave it until its presence is balanced by some days; for if the arrow reaches the brain, death will not be prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not embedded in the bone but only in the flesh and does not pass into the brain, and the patient recovers after some days without any complications from those injuries, then use your ingenuity to remove the arrow and its attraction.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	If it is deeply embedded and resists extraction, then administer treatments along the arrow's path as we have recommended, and carefully care for the area until it heals.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	If the arrow is already embedded in the body but stuck in place, and it is causing pain, then investigate its attachment, and if you feel any resistance, apply some sharp objects to its attraction.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot reach it due to the constriction of the wound and the length of the arrow, here there are neither nerves nor veins, then cut into the wound until it is enlarged and it becomes possible to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if there are auricles attached to it, which should be removed entirely, then cut through the flesh in which it is embedded from all sides using every means at your disposal; and devise a way, if you cannot remove the flesh from around the torn auricles and their twisting, until they heal.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you perform the extraction of the arrow in any location, then use your hand's torsion with forceps from all sides until it tightens; and with subtlety and the utmost care to prevent the arrow from breaking, and successfully extract it along with the wound.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot reach it with your tools, then wait for a few days until the swelling in the wound's area decreases, and then try again when the pain has subsided.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	If you experience difficulty due to bleeding, then administer what we have mentioned for treatment in its chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And take care to cut the vein or nerve, or string, and administer remedies in every possible way to facilitate the escape of the arrow; do this with ease, tranquility, delay, and firmness as much as you can and as recommended by your physician.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore, contract the arrowhead in such a way that the injury is according to the figure by which you aim to hit the target of the arrow, for it is more beneficial.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	If this is not possible for you, then administer what is possible for you according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	Also, the arrows that are shot against the opposite side or have already struck any part on the outside of the body, or whose tip shows signs of bending due to the pressure from below and above the skin, you should remove it; and hold it with pincers, if necessary, according to the amount they take up; then shoot it away, for it is made lighter by impact.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	If it is held in the bone, then you use a sharp knife according to the direction that the arrow penetrates into the bone, amplifying the cut and then extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if that does not help after several days, then repeat the process as often as necessary.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	If the shaft of the arrow is within the bone, then you push it towards the opening.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	If the shaft has fallen and you want to give a thrust, then insert a pointed instrument, if it is hard, strike it sharply into the concave part of the bone where the arrowhead is located, and push it towards the opening.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	If the arrowhead is concave, then push it strongly towards the instrument, as the arrowhead will be guided away by that.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	If the arrow is embedded, you must press all your weight into the flesh where it is truly stuck, if possible, and take care of that area as best you can.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the arrow strikes the foot, or the abdomen, or the bladder, or the side, and it is near enough that you can feel it, and if it is possible to extract it without causing injury to veins or nerves, then extract it and treat the wound as necessary until it heals.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Design of forceps for extracting arrows:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Their ends should be shaped like a bird's beak, made with a serrated edge to grasp the arrow firmly so that it does not slip.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And these are made in various sizes, large, small, and medium, according to the amount of the arrow's thickness, its fragility, the width of the wound, and the tightness of the area.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	The form of driving out the concave end with pain from outside so that the arrow's intrusion is removed from it, and pushing from that side.
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Method of driving out the stiff end:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	so that it is driven out from the concave arrow and pushed towards that side.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	On venipuncture.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins for flebotomy, of which there are several, include: two pulsatile veins near the auricles, called the temporal arteries; two veins in each eyebrow, known as the lacrimal ducts; a vein located in the middle part of the forehead and one at the tip of the nose; two jugular veins at the nape of the neck; two veins on the upper lip; two on the lower lip; these are called the alare veins; and finally, two veins on the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	When the veins that are flebotomized in the arms; for from them comes a cephalic vein, and it is necessary to use wild lettuce; and the people call it "the vein of the head," and also "the deaf one," and it is the median vein, composed of a branch of the basilic and another branch of the cephalic; and the people call it "the vein of the whole body," the basilic vein which is paused in the domestic armpit is called "citular," and the common people call it "vein of the belly"; and the funis of the arm, paused on the fossa, is the one where flebotomy is performed, and is the one that appears on the skin through manifest appearance; and the saveola, which is the vein between the said auricular and the smaller said vein, is only two branches deep.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And on the foot and leg there are three veins; one of them is left at the curvature of the end of the wild lettuce; the second is superficial, and its location is left at the cuff of the domestic lettuce; and the sciatic vein, whose place is left at the cuff of the wild lettuce; and in the cuff there are other veins similar to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The treatment of veins that are close to the auricles is for old catarrh, emaciation, scurf and ulcers on the head, ancient evil conditions.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of bleeding from those veins depends on what you have learned: it should be done at the base of the patient's head, and rub the patient's head on the occiput at the place where both veins are located close to their auricles with a good friction; tighten the bandage around the patient's head so that both appear and the locations where their auricles are firmly pressed in two parts from the head; and if you want to follow this method, and if you feel the pulse of those veins as described above, do it.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Now take the scalpel, one that is sharp, and insert it into the vein in the neck until the fluotomy reaches the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And raise your hand over the vein and bone, and cut into the vein with a sharp incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And the length of the incision should be about two fingers wide, or as needed; and cut through the flesh as deeply as you wish.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then apply strong compresses and leave it until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And as mentioned at the beginning of this text, the incision and cauterization of these are to be done.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	However, of the two veins and arteries that are located on the temples, the jugular vein is an ancient and serious evil, leading to frequent headaches and acute overflowing of fluids in the joints.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of performing a phlebotomy on these is as follows: compress the patient's neck until two veins appear by visible evidence and confirm the pulse below them, and then you should proceed cautiously.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And then, raise the cord over the vein as indicated by your finger, insert the sharp phlebotomy instrument beneath it, and elevate the vein; cut through it in the same way you have done with the other two veins; and allow the blood to flow according to the amount of your need.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then, close the incision of the patient's hernia, place your finger over the vein for an hour, apply pressure to that side and moisten it with a poultice, and tighten it firmly until it heals.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And now, having preceded the recollection of them, and those of their incisions, attract them to the beginning of the opening.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	Thus, the application of phlebotomy to the vein of the forehead is appropriate for ancient face diseases, migraines, and putrid wounds.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of the flebotomy is according to what you have learned; so that the disease tightens its collar with a bandage in which the vein appears; and then take the instrument called a phleatome, which has this form.
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Stop the point at the prominent end of the phleatome on that vein and strike it with a gentle or other appropriate motion in the manner of the instrument, and let the blood flow according to the amount you wish; then remove the perforation from the patient's disease and tighten it until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	And in some cases, the phlebotomy is opened widely, but it is not appropriate to perform a phlebotomy of extreme acuteness as with other phlebotomies, but rather of a lateral extremity, and phlebotomize that according to the transverse, because the bone is close and strong, it would easily break during the delicate phlebotomy.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	However, the juices of the two veins that are the tears of both eyes due to itching and irritation in the eyes, and to the diseases of the face.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	And the quality of the phlebotomy is that the illness tightens the vein in one place, and then you make a phlebotomy there, while standing over the patient's head.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And the phlebotomy should be made according to the transverse direction along a little bit of phlebotomy, for in the place there is no flesh; and if the phlebotomy is subtle, then only the tip of it should be cut.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then allow the bleeding to continue as much as is necessary, and press on those parts, tighten them for a night, and then loosen them.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	The phlebotomy of the nasal vein is useful for acute fever and violent chills, and for facial illnesses and migraines and redness that occurs on the face, especially when it is long-standing.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the quality of the phlebotomy for him is that the illness tightens its grip and you take his nose with your left hand, and make a subtle long phlebotomy at the middle part of the nose according to its straightness, because the vein does not hurt in this place, and because the blood begins to flow soon.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	Be sure to carefully clean your hand with water and soap before touching the patient, since unclean hands can cause further infections. Endure slowly your fingers in the flebotomy, allowing the blood to flow according to your need; then tie it off tightly for a night, as the wound will heal more easily.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	After the flebotomy, both openings should be tightly bound to prevent blood loss and facilitate the beginning of healing, as well as combat infections, inflammation, and aggressive or corrosive ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	The effectiveness of the flebotomy lies in that it draws out the illness from each part of the body; the healer should be positioned at the head of the patient, and the patient should lie on their side.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	Then, make a small but deep flebotomy in the vein of the limb, removing blood according to its volume or as much as necessary; then close it with a bandage similar to that of the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And then carefully loosen the ligament and tighten both veins with moderate pressure to prevent further inflammation, and leave it within the bandage until the pain is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And regarding the surgical incision of the veins, it deals with small abscesses and pustules in the mouth, and the corruption of the gums and bad ulcers and fissures, as well as bad ulcers on the nose and around the anus.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of this surgical procedure is that it stops the disease in its track and tightens its hold with a bandage, then turns the lip edges inside out and examines both veins, of which one is on the right side of the lip and the other on the left; each one is identified by the darkness of both, especially so around those areas where smaller veins are present. Then incise each one with a precise cut.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	If doubt still persists, and you do not know which one it is, then understand that you should proceed to incision of the larger one among them, and remove any visible pus from those areas.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make it look like the two veins that are on their lips.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	It is often necessary to cut both veins that are on the patient's lips.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	When both veins that are on the tongue are involved, it is appropriate to perform phlebotomy of the cephalic vein at its proximal parts, which are in the throat, as well as for conditions of the uvula and oral cavity.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	The quality of phlebotomy is such that it follows the disease among your fingers in front of the sun, lifts the tongue, and observes beneath the tongue, from one side where the vein is and from the other side, and the color of each changes to blackness.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	And then perform phlebotomy on each one; and be careful not to end up with your hand in phlebotomy of those, for those are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your veins that are phlebotomized in the thigh are those through which blood usually flows in all men, and the phlebotomy of them is performed in two ways, either by applying a phlebotomizing needle with a drop of myrtle or olive oil, or by making a cut with a phlebotomizing knife, and it is called arteriotomie, and this is its form.

Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Form of myrtle phlebotomy:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Both the thickness of it [the myrtle] and its length, and it is used to open the concave veins full of thick, clotted blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the form of olive oil phlebotomy:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this fluctometry is of smaller extent and has more subtle endings, suitable for fluctometries of delicate veins that contain subtle citrus blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	However, the juvenation of the fluctometry of the basil vein, which is one of three veins: it extracts the blood from the maladies that are left in the gullet and intestines, and from this, the feet and belly are healed.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it is necessary for the fluctometrist, when performing that fluctometry, to preserve that and be wary of it, because it has an artery, and if he err and misplace the puncture of the fluctometry, he will incise that artery and cause a flow of blood, so it is necessary not to fluctometize that part with a sharp fluctometry, but rather cut it with alnessil.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basil vein does not appear by manifest appearance, then you must know that you should leave that one and change to another, or seek some of its branches; or fluctometize in the place where it ends in the arm, because that is manifest; and you must incise that one with alnessil as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	If you wish to perform a flebotomy on the patient, first cover the stricture of the arm you will be using, and locate the spot within it where the pulse is felt; then press down upon it tightly; bring the arm close, and with a sharp cut make a flebotomy on the concave vein; and be careful to avoid striking the artery in any space of the location.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you press, and strengthen the ligament, there appears an inflation in the spot that you have pressed tightly; that inflation is an inflammation of the artery, and therefore you should avoid it.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you feel the flow of blood in the flebotomy as with a horn (ampullary) vein, and the flow is subtle and quick, be aware that it is from an arterial flow; then cut and press on it for a long time; and if the flow stops, as you can see, it is stopped, tighten the arm and leave it.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And observe the patient from the moisture of their body, and be extremely careful of them and do not harm that for a few days until they are healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	If the stone cannot be removed and you are not skilled in medicine for this, then incise the artery if it appears to you; because the end of the stone is contracted and the stone is dislodged; or take a piece of fig and make a hole in it, and insert that, and take one third of its size and tighten it over the site of the vein with tape and poultices for another day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And if the stone is dislodged, then it is good; but if not, treat that with the water as mentioned before in the recollection of the place of the dislodged stones' flow.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the removal of the stone from him is difficult due to the location of the pain and the possibility of ligature of the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	From the dark vein, phlebotomy is useful to extract blood from the upper part of the head and leave it from the lower parts of the body; for this reason, it is composed of branches of the basilic vein and branches of the cephalic vein, as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa. This nerve causes sensitivity; if it is hidden in some people and is subtle and not visible, you must pause the phlebotomy with which you are cutting off the vein and avoid the nerve with all your might.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then cut the vein along its length.
